API

class modules.MIRACLE.MIRACLE(data, status)[source]

Bases: object

BallTreeSubsample(data, target_size)[source]
gen_datasets(data)[source]

Generate dataset object.

Parameters

data (create_data object) – a “create_data” object

init_model(train_mod='denovo', lr=0.0001, drop_s=0, s_drop_rate=0.1, grad_clip=-1, dim_c=32, dim_b=2, dims_enc_s=[16, 16], dims_enc_chr=[128, 32], dims_enc_x=[1024, 128], dims_discriminator=[128, 64], norm='ln', drop=0.2, model_path=None, benchmark_path=None)[source]

Initalize the model.

Parameters

  • train_mod (str) – The action to the model. - denovo : To train a model without using replay data, you can provide either the model_path or benchmark_path parameter to load the weights or training status from a file. If you wish to resume training from a specific checkpoint, please ensure that you provide both the model_path and benchmark_path parameters. - continual : To train a model using replay data, make sure to initialize the object with data under the “replay” status.

  • lr (float) – Learning rate.

  • drop_s (int) – Force to drop s.

  • s_drop_rate (float) – Drop out rate for s.

  • grad_clip (int) – Whether to clip the grad during training.

  • norm (str) – Type of normalization.

  • drop (float) – Drop out rate for the hidden layers.

  • dim_c (int) – Dimension of the variable c.

  • dim_b (int) – Dimension of the variable b.

  • dims_enc_s (list) – Dimensions of the encoder layers for s.

  • dims_enc_chr (list) – Dimensions of the encoder layers for chromosomes. (Used when there is atac data)

  • dims_enc_x (list) – Dimensions of the encoder layers for data (except atac).

  • dims_discriminator (list) – Dimensions of the discriminator layers.

  • model_path (str) – The path for the model weight. A “.pt” file.

  • benchmark_path (str) – The path for the training status. A “.toml” file.

pack(output_task_name='pack', des_dir='./data/processed/', n_sample=100000, pred_dir=None)[source]

Pack the data for future training or sharing.

Parameters

  • output_task_name (str) – The output name. des_dir + output_task_name

  • des_dir (str) – Path to save the data.

  • n_sample (int) – The target number of samples.

  • pred_dir (str) – Path of the embeddings.

predict(save_dir='./result/experiment/predict/', joint_latent=True, mod_latent=False, impute=False, batch_correct=False, translate=False, input=False, mini_batch_size=256)[source]

Predict the embeddings or their imputed expression.

Parameters

  • save_dir (str) – The path to save the predicted files.

  • joint_latent (bool) – Whether to save the joint embeddings.

  • mod_latent (bool) – Whether to save the embeddings for each modalities.

  • impute (bool) – Whether to save the imputed data.

  • batch_correct (bool) – Whether to save the batch corrected expression data.

  • translate (bool) – Whether to save the translation embeddings (from a modality to another modality).

  • input (bool) – Whether to save the inputs.

  • mini_batch_size (int) – The mini-batch size for saving. Influence the cell number in the csv file.

randomsampling(alist, number)[source]
read_embeddings(emb_path=None, joint_latent=True, mod_latent=False, impute=False, batch_correct=False, translate=False, input=False, group_by='modality')[source]

Get embeddings or other outputs from a path.

Parameters

  • emb_path (str) – If not given, use the path from the function predict() if you have run it.

  • joint_latent (bool) – Whether to read the joint embeddings.

  • impute (bool) – Whether to read the imputed expression data.

  • batch_correct (bool) – Whether to read the batch corrected expression data.

  • translate (bool) – Whether to read the translated embeddings.

  • input (bool) – Whether to read the inputs.

  • group_by (bool) – Group the data by “modality” or “batch”.

Returns

The embeddings from the given path.

class modules.MIRACLE.create_data(data_path, mods=None, print_info=True)[source]

Bases: object

An object named MIRACLE will be created to represent the data. The data information, including the cell number and features, will be automatically detected.
